section.title: Change result display options
section.p: Your search results, or Answers, have various display options. You can change the visualization used to display your results, their sort order, how ThoughtSpot groups the data, and what data ThoughtSpot includes.

section.title: Change the view
section.p: You can change the view of your answer so it appears as either a table or a chart. To change the view of your answer:

li.p: Toggle between either a table or a chart type.

section.p: When you display your data as a chart, ThoughtSpot automatically selects the type of chart that works best for your data. If you want to use another type, click the change visualization icon ![]({{ site.baseurl }}/images/icon-chart-type-20px.png){: .inline} and select the type of chart you want. Refer to [understand charts]({{ site.baseurl }}/end-user/search/about-charts.html).

section.title: Sort your search
section.p: Sorting your search allows you to order your answer, making it easier to read. To sort your search:

li.p: If you are in the data (table) view, click the column header you would like to sort on.

By default, sorting applies in descending order. For example, if the column has numerical values, it would start at the highest number and decrease. Click the column header again to sort in ascending order.
If you are in the chart view, click the axis label of your chart that you would like to sort and select Sort. You can choose to sort in ascending or descending order.

section.title: Change the date bucketing (grouping)
section.p: You can change the date bucketing on tables and charts for columns with date values. Bucketing is a method for grouping a column in your data. For example, if you have a column of orders, you can use the date of each order (NO_BUCKET).
Alternatively, you can group these MONTHLY:

ThoughtSpot chooses a default date bucket for you when you search. This default takes the entire search result into account. For example, if your search includes last month, dates are bucketed daily instead of monthly.

li.p: In a table view, use the date bucket drop-down, under the column header.
On a chart, you can change the change the axis label.

section.p: The bucket values are a subset of date and time-period keywords. To change the date bucketing, follow these steps:

li.p: Go to the table or chart you want to change.
Locate the column or axis value with the date value you want to change.

section.title: Exclude and include row values
section.p: You can include or exclude row values from your answer.
To exclude or include row values:

li.p: Right-click the visualization or table cell of interest.
Select Exclude "value" or Only Include "value" if available.
